posts.title: NASA astronauts splash down off Florida coast after nine months stuck in space
top_comments: The pod of dolphins showing up to check out the capsule is pretty cool.
Imaging not having someone at home to take care of the bs. “Oh im only gone 8 days, ill pay that when i get back”

"Leave it to tomorrow to unpack my case, honey disconnect the phone" - Beatles  
Welcome home folks! There is beer, pizza and cake in the fridge.
Taking a crap in gravity is gonna be so sweet for these folks.

Welcome back.


Those parachutes were beautiful.


As was the light.
They might go back to the ISS once they see all the news from the last 6 months.
That’s the first time I’ve ever heard anything described as “off the coast of Tallahassee”.  That’s like if it was in the Atlantic and saying, “off the coast of Wash. DC”.

It’s worth noting that Butch and Suni weren’t really stranded. The capsule that brought them back has been docked to the station for the last 6 months and prior to that they had other emergency escape options. The main thing keeping them up there was logistics, bringing them home earlier would either mean spending >100 million on a dedicated mission to bring them down or leaving the station uncrewed for *months.* It’s also worth noting that while 9 months is a long ISS stay it’s not especially long. The normal crew mission to the ISS lasts 6 months and there have been people who have stayed for over a year. Now that isn’t to minimize the struggle of the astronauts, I’m sure they are happy to be finally returning home today after so long away from their families but I just wanted to provide context to their return. The media has done an especially poor job of covering the Starlinner situation and that was even for Musk and Trump made this an extremely political issue.

“Get ready to say thank you profusely, nerds!”

-JD Vance
I bet those two NEVER want to see each other again.

posts.title: Amazon sues government safety agency over having to recall products from other sellers
top_comments: There’s still a US government agency that hasn’t been dismantled?

It's about time they're held liable for the crap they put on the market.  I learned how to avoid 3rd party merchandise on Amazon until Amazon began misrepresenting the origin.  Navigating fair trade has seldom been more difficult.  Yes, you can return that defective merch as long as you're willing to lug it to the PO or arrange private carriers.  Disingenuous at best; criminal when you have a Prime account.

Every product/manufacturer/retailer has a market cycle and Amazon is floundering but so are other e-tailers.

Because Amazon controls the entire logistics chain and is best suited to handle recalls. Amazon also controls access to that chain and the information customers can get about the products. Amazon is responsible for creating the system through which recalled products are necessary. Why does Amazon allow the sale of so many recalled products that it's a burden? Amazon is free to institute whatever recall conditions it may required between it and the sellers they freely agreed to partner with. Why wouldn't Amazon be responsible for recalls of products sold through them?
Awwww. Too bad. So sad.

> During the proceedings, Amazon did not contest that the products presented a substantial hazard, but argued that it is not a distributor and is not responsible for protecting the public from products sold by third parties.

Oh, we'll happily profit from those using our platform to sell dangerous products, but don't you dare hold us responsible.

> The commission in **July 2024** ruled that Amazon was distributing products that are defective or fail to meet federal safety standards. The CPSC also said Amazon was legally responsible for the recall of more than 400,000 products, including faulty carbon monoxide detectors, hairdryers without electrocution protection and **children's sleepwear that violates federal flammability standards.** 

I can only imagine what Amazon founder Jeff Bezos said when he stopped the Washington Post editorial board from endorsing Kamala Harris: *"The Democrats are trying to stop us from burning America's children to death in their sleep; we can't let their bleeding-heart, pro-child agenda win!"* 

> "The commission may issue recall orders to the manufacturers, distributors and retailers of a product, but not to third-party logistics providers who store the product in their warehouses and transport it to customers," Amazon stated its suit, filed on March 14 in the U.S. District Court for the District of Maryland. 

*"We're not a 'distributor,' we're just a warehouser/transporter. We're not a 'retailer,' we just sell retail goods to customers."*

I was at least a little empathetic to their position until this part.

>Amazon also alleges that the CPSC's structure is unconstitutional because it lets commissioners "act as judge, jury and prosecutor in the same proceeding."

That's just a "throw shit at the wall" sort of argument and a disingenuous one at that. It is absolutely intended to be red meat to people like Trump and Xitler. 

At the same time, maybe Amazon should consider devoting a little more effort to vetting products before selling them. I mean, if something is, for example, a fire hazard... you'd think they wouldn't want to be storing that in their warehouses regardless of anything else. 

I'd draw the line at who fulfilled the order. If Amazon is fulfilling the order and the item ships out of one of their warehouses... fuck 'em, they're on the hook to help collect units affected by recalls. If the third party is shipping directly to the customer, just using Amazon's site as a way to reach customers, then Amazon doesn't need to be involved.

*"Amazon's suit suggests the company thinks the people of the United States would be better off without an independent, bipartisan safety agency to enforce our laws and protect consumers from dangerous products."*

The way the Trump Admin is operating, Amazon probably only has to wait a little longer for one more citizen protective agency to be dismantled... billionaires for billionaires.

Such a feeble legal argument, the lawyers should be fired.

"We just store this stuff in our warehouses and transport it to customers."

Oh yeah? when's the last time you could shop the various products being shipped out at USPS?  eh?  you can buy packaging, you cannot buy the products being shipped.  they don't sell items process payment.

What a shitty way to try to say they are not a retailer.

they might have a chance in the edge case of someone having a "purchase/pay with amazon." button on their website for payment since the customer is not shopping the amazon website they are using amazon as a payment processor and then the choice to ship logistically through them comes in.   but if I browse a selection of products on your website, make a selection and pay, YOU ARE THE RETAILER.   they're gonna get wrecked here.

Further fwiw they could be considered a distributor due to the network of warehouses, some amazon product suppliers dont ever hold the product themselves... the manufacturer ships directly to amazon and amazon then distributes it... that's TWO legs!!!
It'd be a shame if the safety agency were to be dismantled. Then Amazon would need to talk to the head chief and meter maid directly

posts.title: Woman faces attempted murder charges after Elmore County deputy shot
top_comments:
#Alabama Woman Charged with Attempted Murder After Deputy Shot in Shocking Confrontation

A routine call to investigate a theft in Elmore County, Alabama, took a dramatic and violent turn when a woman allegedly pulled a gun and shot a deputy, landing herself behind bars on attempted murder charges.

The suspect, 40-year-old Ebony Bracy from Wetumpka, had initially been speaking with officers when the situation escalated. According to Sheriff Bill Franklin, she was reportedly incoherent when deputies arrived at the scene on Dozier Road in the Redland community. As officers conducted their investigation, they discovered Bracy had outstanding warrants, though details of these were not immediately disclosed.

When they attempted to take her into custody, she allegedly drew a firearm and opened fire, hitting one deputy in the forearm. The bullet travelled up to his bicep, wounding him. In the chaos that followed, another deputy fired back, striking Bracy in the upper torso. Though the extent of her injury was not fully detailed, the sheriff suggested she would likely need stitches. A second woman, who had been standing behind Bracy, was also caught in the crossfire, taking a bullet to the thigh.

Bracy is now being held at the Elmore County Jail with bail set at a staggering $2 million. The state has launched an investigation into the incident, though officials have yet to release further details.

What started as a theft report ended with gunfire, injuries and serious charges, leaving the community rattled and authorities determined to piece together exactly what led to the shocking turn of events.
You're supposed to shoot the sheriff, not the deputy! Did this woman not ever hear the song!? /s
I'm honestly surprised she made it out of that alive

But what about his past? Has he ever been in trouble with speeding tickets? DUI? Probably deserved it. /s

And why didn’t he check behind his target before opening fire? Gun safety rule #3. 
No /s.

posts.title: NASA astronauts splash down off Florida coast after nine months stuck in space
top_comments: The pod of dolphins showing up to check out the capsule is pretty cool.
Imaging not having someone at home to take care of the bs. “Oh im only gone 8 days, ill pay that when i get back”

"Leave it to tomorrow to unpack my case, honey disconnect the phone" - Beatles  
Welcome home folks! There is beer, pizza and cake in the fridge.
Taking a crap in gravity is gonna be so sweet for these folks.

Welcome back.


Those parachutes were beautiful.


As was the light.
They might go back to the ISS once they see all the news from the last 6 months.
That’s the first time I’ve ever heard anything described as “off the coast of Tallahassee”.  That’s like if it was in the Atlantic and saying, “off the coast of Wash. DC”.

It’s worth noting that Butch and Suni weren’t really stranded. The capsule that brought them back has been docked to the station for the last 6 months and prior to that they had other emergency escape options. The main thing keeping them up there was logistics, bringing them home earlier would either mean spending >100 million on a dedicated mission to bring them down or leaving the station uncrewed for *months.* It’s also worth noting that while 9 months is a long ISS stay it’s not especially long. The normal crew mission to the ISS lasts 6 months and there have been people who have stayed for over a year. Now that isn’t to minimize the struggle of the astronauts, I’m sure they are happy to be finally returning home today after so long away from their families but I just wanted to provide context to their return. The media has done an especially poor job of covering the Starlinner situation and that was even for Musk and Trump made this an extremely political issue.

“Get ready to say thank you profusely, nerds!”

-JD Vance
I bet those two NEVER want to see each other again.
